name: Pardis Emami Naeini
content: Pardis Emami-Naeini Pardis Emami-Naeini pardis@cs.duke.edu Director of Duke InSPIre Lab Duke University Computer Science Department Office: LSRC D327 Link to CV At Duke Interdisciplinary Security, Privacy, and Interaction Research (InSPIre) lab, we conduct user-centered research to uncover security and privacy (S&P) needs and values of stakeholders and shape technologies and policies. Selected Awards & Honors Google Systems and ML Research Gift Award, 2025. Google AI Research Scholar Program Award, 2024. Selected the Top 5% Instructor in the Duke Trinity College, 2024. ORAU Ralph E. Powe Junior Faculty Enhancement Award, 2023. Duke Arts & Sciences Council Committee on Faculty Research (ASC-CFR) Award, 2023. Duke Science and Technology Scholar, 2022. IEEE S&P paper selected to be highlighted in the IEEE Security and Privacy Magazine, 2021. CyLab Presidential Fellowship, 2019. Rising Stars Research Pitch Award, 2019. Best Paper Award at CHI, 2017. Recent Service Program Committee Member, USENIX Security, 2026. Program Committee Member, CHI, 2026. Program Committee Member, USENIX Security, 2025. Program Committee Member, CHI, 2025. Cultural Competence in Computing (3C) Fellow, 2025. Program Committee Member, USENIX Security, 2024. Program Committee Member, CHI, 2024. Program Committee Member, IEEE S&P, 2024. Grant Review Panel Member, National Science Foundation (NSF), 2023. Grant Review Panel Member, Swiss National Science Foundation (SNSF), 2023. Senior Program Committee Member, FAccT, 2023. Program Committee Member, USENIX Security, 2023. Program Committee Member, CSCW, 2023. Program Committee Member, IEEE S&P, 2023. Program Committee Member, PETS, 2023.
